TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TintEffect extends DocumentFormat.OpenXml.OpenXmlLeafElement

Docs.summary: Defines the TintEffect Class. When the object is serialized out as xml, its qualified name is a:tint.

remarks.format:
## Remarks [!INCLUDE[openxmlnoticeiso](~/includes/openxmlnoticeiso.md)] **tint (Tint Effect)** This element specifies a tint effect. Shifts effect color values towards/away from hue by the specified amount. |Parent Elements| |---------------------| |blip (§20.1.8.13); cont (§20.1.8.20); effectDag (§20.1.8.25)| |Attributes|Description| |----------------|-----------------| |amt (Amount)|Specifies by how much the color value is shifted.

The possible values for this attribute are defined by the *ST_FixedPercentage* simple type (§20.1.10.24).| |hue (Hue)|Specifies the hue towards which to tint.

The possible values for this attribute are defined by the *ST_PositiveFixedAngle* simple type (§20.1.10.44).| [*Note*: The W3C XML Schema definition of this element’s content model (CT_TintEffect) is located in §A.4.1. *end note*] [!INCLUDE[openxmlnoticeiso](~/includes/openxmlcopyrightiso.md)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TintEffect class.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.Amount : DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Int32Value with get, set

Docs.summary: Amount.Represents the following attribute in the schema: amt

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following information from the ECMA International [Standard ECMA-376](http://www.ecma-international.org/publications/standards/Ecma-376.htm) can be useful when working with this class.
Specifies by how much the color value is shifted.
The possible values for this attribute are defined by the `ST_FixedPercentage` simple type.
